unnormalised: Someone asked me about the difference between Sec 307 and Sec 302 of the IPC. It reminded me of a case I followed back in '08. It involved a chap named Rajesh, a rickshaw puller from Patna. Rajesh got into a fight with his neighbor, Suresh, over a water dispute. Things escalated quickly. Rajesh, in a fit of rage, picked up a heavy stone and hit Suresh on the head. Suresh was rushed to PMCH (Patna Medical College and Hospital) in critical condition.
normalised: Someone asked me about the difference between Section three hundred and seven and Section three hundred and two of the I-P-C. It reminded me of a case I followed back in two thousand and eight. It involved a chap named Rajesh, a rickshaw puller from Patna. Rajesh got into a fight with his neighbor, Suresh, over a water dispute. Things escalated quickly. Rajesh, in a fit of rage, picked up a heavy stone and hit Suresh on the head. Suresh was rushed to P-M-C-H (Patna Medical College and Hospital) in critical condition.

unnormalised: The police initially filed a case under IPC Section 307, which deals with “Attempt to Murder.” This is because Suresh was still alive, albeit in serious condition. The investigation hinged on whether Rajesh intended to kill Suresh or just cause grievous hurt. The difference is crucial because the punishment under Section 307 is less severe than under Section 302. The prosecution had to prove Rajesh's intent.
normalised: The police initially filed a case under I-P-C Section three hundred and seven, which deals with "Attempt to Murder." This is because Suresh was still alive, albeit in serious condition. The investigation hinged on whether Rajesh intended to kill Suresh or just cause grievous hurt. The difference is crucial because the punishment under Section three hundred and seven is less severe than under Section three hundred and two. The prosecution had to prove Rajesh's intent.

unnormalised: Sadly, Suresh succumbed to his injuries 3 days later, on 12/07/2008. With Suresh's death, the charges against Rajesh were amended to IPC Section 302, which deals with "Murder." The court eventually convicted Rajesh under Section 302, taking into account the severity of the injury and the intent inferred from the weapon used – a heavy stone aimed at the head. He got life imprisonment, a stark reminder of how a moment of anger can change someone's life forever. Adv. Sharma was the defense lawyer, and he tried his best, but the evidence was quite strong against Rajesh.
normalised: Sadly, Suresh succumbed to his injuries three days later, on twelfth July two thousand and eight. With Suresh's death, the charges against Rajesh were amended to I-P-C Section three hundred and two, which deals with "Murder." The court eventually convicted Rajesh under Section three hundred and two, taking into account the severity of the injury and the intent inferred from the weapon used – a heavy stone aimed at the head. He got life imprisonment, a stark reminder of how a moment of anger can change someone's life forever. Advocate Sharma was the defense lawyer, and he tried his best, but the evidence was quite strong against Rajesh.
